intro: Vernonia polypleura, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features include a woody stem and an upright growth habit, making it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats.
